name: Data Quality and Summary
description: Validating the data quality and generate summary statistics reports.

workflow.name: Rows and Columns
workflow.description: The questions to be answered serve as guides in EDA

steps.name: Descriptions
steps.description: What does the row mean?

steps.name: Descriptions
steps.description: What does the column mean?

steps.name: Count
steps.description: How many columns?

steps.name: Possible values or ranges
steps.description: List the theoretical limits on the values and validate against the data.

steps.name: Data Types
steps.description: What is each column consists of?

steps.name: Types of data
steps.description: Ordinal, Nominal, Interval, Generative, etc

steps.name: Is the type of the data correct
Are the dates loaded as dates?
Are the numbers loaded as numbers?
steps.description: Are they strings?

steps.name: Are the financial values correct?
steps.description: Are they strings or numbers? EU format, US format?

workflow.name: Missing Values
workflow.description: Are there missing values in each column

steps.name: Different types of missing values
steps.description: Notations of missing values are different in different datasets. Read the documentation of the dataset to find out.

steps.name: Standard missing values
steps.description: nan, nat, None, na, null...

steps.name: Represented with a specific value
steps.description: -1, 0, MISSING, ...

steps.name: Percentage of missing values in each column
Visualizations
steps.description: e.g., missingno python package

steps.name: Validate by yourself
steps.description: Do not trust the metadata and documentation of the dataset. Duplications of fields may occur when the documentation says they are unique.

steps.name: Is it a histogram analysis of another row?
Is it a linear combination of other rows?
Visualize the distributions of the values
steps.description: Know all the values

steps.name: Value count bar plot
steps.description: For descrete data, list all possible values and counts

steps.name: Histogram and KDE
steps.description: for continuous data, use histograms or KDE.

steps.name: Boxplot
steps.description: Boxplot is easier to understand for business people

steps.name: Scatter plot
steps.description: Gut feeling of where the data points are located

steps.name: Numerical Summarization
steps.description: Use summary statistics to find out the moments.

steps.name: Locations
steps.description: Mean, median, quartiles, mode...

steps.name: Spreads
steps.description: range, variance, standard deviation, IQR

steps.name: Skewness
steps.description: asymmetries

steps.name: Correlations
steps.description: Pearson, Kendall Tau Correlation

steps.name: Distances
steps.description: Calculate the distance between features or rows to understand the relations between them; Euclidean distance, Mahalanobis distance, Minkowski distance, Jaccard distance, ...

workflow.name: Size
workflow.description: How much space will the data take on our storage device?

steps.name: Memory usage
steps.description: To estimate the hardware requirements when deploying the model

steps.name: Storage on Hard Drive in Different Formats
steps.description: How much space will the dataset take in different formats?

workflow.name: Combining Data Files
workflow.description: One dataset may come in different files, combine them carefully.

steps.name: Concat
steps.description: The files should be concated with caution.

steps.name: Validate overlap
steps.description: Check if there is an overlap between the files.
